abstract: The retailer said it will pay from $352 million to $640 million to settle lawsuits over wages and work rules.
snippet: The retailer said it will pay from $352 million to $640 million to settle lawsuits over wages and work rules.
lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart said on Tuesday that it would pay at least $352 million, and possibly far more, to settle lawsuits across the country claiming that it forced employees to work off the clock. Several lawyers described it as the largest settlement ever for lawsuits over wage violations.

headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart to Settle Suits Over Pay for $352 Million

byline.original: By Steven Greenhouse and Stephanie Rosenbloom
